broadwick.statistics

Class Samples

  • java.lang.Object
    • broadwick.statistics.Samples
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Serializable

    public class Samples
extends Object
implements Serializable
    This class collects data values and calculates their mean and variance.
    See Also:

    • Constructor Detail

      • Samples

        public Samples()
        Empty object where the internal values are initialised to 0. Getting any statistics from this object will result in a divide by zero exceptions since there are zero elements in the accumulator.

      • Samples

        public Samples(double value)
        Initialise the internal values of the accumulator with the argument given.
        Parameters:
        value - the value to initialise the internal variables.

    • Method Detail

      • add

        public final Samples add(double value)
        Add an observable (value) to the accumulator.
        Parameters:
        value - add the value to the accumulated values.
        Returns:
        the current accumulator object.

      • add

        public final Samples add(Samples value)
        Add the contents of anther accumulator to this accumulator.
        Parameters:
        value - add the value to the accumulated values.
        Returns:
        the current accumulator object.

      • getMean

        public final double getMean()
        Obtain the mean of the set of observables in the accumulator.
        Returns:
        double the mean in the observed values.

      • getRootMeanSquare

        public final double getRootMeanSquare()
        Obtain the root mean square of the set of observables in the accumulator.
        Returns:
        double the root mean square in the observed values.

      • getGeometricMean

        public final double getGeometricMean()
        Obtain the geometric mean of the set of observables in the accumulator.
        Returns:
        double the geometric mean in the observed values.

      • getHarmonicMean

        public final double getHarmonicMean()
        Obtain the harmonic mean of the set of observables in the accumulator.
        Returns:
        double the harmonic mean in the observed values.

      • getSum

        public final double getSum()
        Get the sum of the values held in the accumulator.
        Returns:
        the sum of all the values added to the accumulator.

      • getSize

        public final int getSize()
        Get the number of items added to the Accumulator.
        Returns:
        the number of items added to the Accumulator.

      • getVariance

        public final double getVariance()
        Default sample variance implementation based on the second moment \f$ M_n^{(2)} \f$ moment<2>, mean and count. \f[ \sigma_n^2 = M_n^{(2)} - \mu_n^2. \f] where \f[ \mu_n = \frac{1}{n} \sum_{i = 1}^n x_i. \f] is the estimate of the sample mean and \f$n\f$ is the number of samples.
        Returns:
        double the variance of the observed values.

      • getStdDev

        public final double getStdDev()
        Obtain the standard deviation (error in the mean) of the set of observeables in the accumulator.
        Returns:
        double the standard deviation in the observed values.

      • clear

        public final void clear()
        Clear the contents of the accumulator. Sets all the internal counts back to zero.

      • getSummary

        public final String getSummary()
        Get a tab delimited string of the mean and standard deviation of the values in the accumulator.
        Returns:
        a string in the form "\tmean\tdev"
